section.title: Creating a Policy for Automate
section.para: This procedure shows you how to create a policy for automate.

procedure.title: To Create a Policy for Automate

step.para: Click the Policies accordion, and select Control Policies.

Click
(Configuration), then
(Add a New Control Vm Policy).
Uncheck Active if you do not want this policy processed even when assigned to a resource.
Click Add. You are brought to the page where you add conditions and events to your new policy.

Click
(Configuration), then
(Edit this Policy's Event assignments).

listitem.para: Check the events you want to use to send to an Automate Model.
From the Events area, click on the Description of the Event you want to assign an action to.

Click
(Edit Actions for this Policy Event).

step.para:
Select Raise Automation Event, and click
(Move selected Actions into this Event).

formalpara.title: Result:
formalpara.para: You can now assign this policy to a Policy Profile. Then, assign the policy profile to the virtual machines. Every time this event happens on the virtual machine the appropriate Automate Model will be initiated.

note.para: If you want the policy to initiate an Automate Model from the /System/Process/Request class, then you can create your own custom action. Be sure to have an instance in the /System/Process/Request class for it to map to.
